title: The ‘Donroe Doctrine’: Trump’s Bid to Control the Western Hemisphere
summary: President Trump has tightened the U.S. grip on the Americas by rewarding allies and punishing rivals. That has upended the region’s politics.

summary: Plus, Hollywood’s star-studded movies are tanking.

title: The Crypto Industry’s $28 Billion in ‘Dirty Money’
summary: As President Trump has championed crypto and the industry has gone mainstream, funds from scammers and other criminal groups have flowed onto major crypto exchanges.

title: How Fraudsters Use Cryptocurrency A.T.M.s to Target Victims
summary: The kiosks, which resemble conventional A.T.M.s and convert cash into virtual currencies, are increasingly under scrutiny as a tool for scammers.

title: How to Not Get Kidnapped for Your Bitcoin
summary: Escaping zipties, hiring bodyguards and other practical lessons in self-defense for crypto traders, after a series of gruesome crimes spooked the community.

title: U.S. Border Patrol Arrested 81 People in Charlotte, N.C.
summary: Border Patrol agents descended on Charlotte this weekend searching for immigrants in the country illegally. It remains unclear how long the agents will stay.

title: At Catholic Churches, Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Takes Center Stage
summary: Immigration was on the minds of priests and parishioners following a letter from the nation’s Catholic bishops decrying how immigrants are being treated.

title: New International Student Enrollment Plummeted This Fall, Survey Finds
summary: The overall number of international students enrolled in U.S. colleges and universities, including those who enrolled in prior years or who are working after graduation, fell only slightly.

title: Britain’s Labour Government Plans New, Tougher System for Asylum Seekers
summary: Under the new rules, people granted asylum would have to wait 20 years, rather than the current five, before applying for permanent residency.

title: Andy Baraghani’s Thanksgiving Menu Is Bright, Colorful and Delicious
summary: Andy Baraghani’s bright, brilliant menu is a feast for the eyes, too.

title: Friends Say a Suspect in the Louvre Heist Had Tried to Leave a Rough Past Behind
summary: He had been best known as a daring urban dirt-bike rider who had pulled off stunts at iconic sites in Paris, according to several friends.

title: Zelensky Ousted a Heavyweight Mayor. Was It a Power Grab?
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky removed Odesa’s mayor, raising fears he might be using his wartime powers to tighten control over opposition-run cities.

title: They Can’t Criticize Putin. So They Focus on Recycling or Clean Air.
summary: Opposition-minded Russians who remain in the country are trying to keep politically active in whatever ways they can.

title: Hydropower Is Getting Less Reliable as the World Needs More Energy
summary: Demand for power is growing fast, but hydro plants, the oldest source of clean energy, are struggling because of droughts, floods and other extreme weather linked to climate change.

title: Thousands March for Climate Action as COP30 Talks Enter Second Week
summary: As the talks continue, some countries are pushing for a detailed “road map” for a global transition away from oil, gas and coal.

title: At a Shared Symbol of Jihad, the Taliban Defy Their Old Ties With Pakistan
summary: Afghan officials are lashing out against their former allies in the Pakistani military as hostilities between the two countries intensify.

title: New York’s Bodegas Are Here to Stay
summary: The iconic corner store is perhaps the ultimate symbol of a city constantly evolving and on the move.

title: An Officer Bungled a Teen Rape Case. The Victim Was Abused Again.
summary: The investigator, who did not believe the teen, faced little punishment, illustrating the different ways that officers in New York State are disciplined for misconduct.

title: We Immigrated Legally. ICE Detained Us Anyway.
summary: The brutal detention of three people who came to the U.S. legally reveals a cruel system that operates with impunity.

title: This Is How Our Economy Comes Crashing Down
summary: Some of the pieces seem fine, but the base is increasingly fragile

title: Chaos at the Justice Department
summary: President Trump has transformed the agency. We look at what’s happening on the inside.

title: Aiming to Shock Japan, China Pushes a Wave of Reprisals
summary: Beijing is flexing its military and economic might to show its displeasure with the Japanese leader’s comments about defending Taiwan. But its aggressive approach risks backfiring.

title: Bangladesh Court Sentences Former Leader Sheikh Hasina to Death
summary: The former prime minister, who fled to India last year, was tried in absentia for ordering the use of lethal weapons during the uprising that drove her from power.

title: A Pill for Women’s Libido Meets a Cultural Moment
summary: A decade ago, Cindy Eckert struggled to convince skeptics about a drug for premenopausal women. Lately, her business is booming.

title: Jeff Bezos Creates A.I. Start-Up Where He Will Be Co-Chief Executive
summary: Called Project Prometheus, the company is focusing on artificial intelligence for the engineering and manufacturing of computers, automobiles and spacecraft.
